intro: Rapanea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved rapanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
